sense.name: person who entertains guests
sense.examples: John is always a gracious host at his dinner parties. The hosts of this bed-and-breakfast are a retired couple from Oregon. Bob is our host at the corporate dinner this evening and is picking up the tab.

sense.name: a large set of similar things, often beings
sense.examples: A host of memories rushed into her mind at the sight of the old photo. The painting depicts shepherds at night looking up at a star and a heavenly host of angels. The army met the opposing host on the battlefield. John swatted away a host of gnats around his face. I've got a host of things to do before we leave on vacation.

sense.name: an organism infected with another parasitic organism or pathogen
sense.examples: This species of mosquito is a host for the amoeba that causes malaria. The man traveled widely around the world when he was a host for the HIV virus. The fungus weakens the host plant with its toxins.

sense.name: moderator or emcee of a public event
sense.examples: Pete is a well-known talk show host. John will play host at this year's conference and introduce all the keynote speakers.

sense.name: An organization that sponsors a large public event
sense.examples: Beijing is host to this year's Olympics. A group of high-tech companies is normally the host of this annual science fair.

sense.name: recipient of a donor's transplanted tissue
sense.examples: The host has accepted the donor's kidney successfully. The new technique enables more accurate identification of good matches between hosts and donors.

sense.name: a computer server
sense.examples: The host machine provides data and files to a network of client machines. The host is down so you won't be able to access files until it comes back up.

sense.name: blessed wafer ingested during Holy Communion
sense.examples: The Catholics took the host from the priest. The host is consecrated by a clergyman before it is given out at Communion.

sense.name: geographical region that supports a specific species
sense.examples: Australia is host to some of the world's most dangerous animals. The wetlands are host to many species of birds, but also of insects, including mosquitos.
